channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: There are two blocked gully drains with standing water, 18th December
item.description:
Two blocked gully drains cause flooding. Location is just before and after the Park Hall Road bus stop outside 1 South Croxted Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Croxted Road, Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Please clear.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Champion Park, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 18th December
item.description:
At 16:58 on 18/12/2025, an occupant (female, dark hair tied back, wearing sweater top & joggers bottoms) of 22 Draycott Avenue, was banging a black plastic bin onto the pavement & rubbish fell out onto the pavement. The same woman went into the rear of 22 Draycott Avenue to fetch a broom that she used to sweep the rubbish into the edge of the road & pavement & returned to the rear of 22 Draycott Avenue using the alleyway. That back alleyway (that runs along the back of numbers 18 to 24 Draycott Avenue) is used by some of those occupants to take rubbish out, usually for collecting by refuse collectors NOT to dump rubbish as the described woman did. It is unacceptable for health, safety & environmental reasons to dump rubbish out onto the public highways.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rosemoor Street, Chelsea, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 18th December
item.description:
A utility company previously dug up the road and the council carried out some patchwork repairs on previous potholes. All of this work was carried out to a low standard causing more potholes in between the patchwork of repairs and poor utility work. Combined with increased traffic from Thames Water closing Bromley Common frequently potholes are occurring.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mosslea Road, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 18th December
item.description:
Previously works were carried out on this road to lay two pipes. At the location of these two pipes pot holes are developing as when the roadway was relaid it was completed badly and with a completely different material type. All that needs to happen is put a border of liquid tarmac between the old roadway and the new roadway to prevent this but it never happens. The pipe is laid the quickest cheapest roadway is laid by the utility company and the inevitable potholes are left to the council. If only they improved the specifications of roadway repairs by utility companies and checked it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Road, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaking water mains - manhole / water tap, 18th December
item.description:
This manhole which covers a water access point for fire/ street cleaners is leaking and covering street and wasting water. It will also turn to ice. It has been leaking since 26th Nov 2025

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southgate Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Re-laid slabs loose, 18th December
item.description:
There were recent works on this pavement do broad band. The paving slabs were removed for the works and relaid. Unfortunately they have been relaid without being flat and without a sand cement mix in between so they are now loose and uneven. The last photo shows flat safe paving at the same location which was not removed for the works. The broad band company need to return to fix rather than the Bromley taxpayer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waverley Close, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped Parkside Road at junction with Ashburnham Road, 18th December
item.description:
Thames Water had portacabins and fencing placed here for over a year. They have now finished their work and moved on. What has been left is rubbish dumped arounnd the portacabins. I expected Thames water to get rid of the rubbish but I was disappointed when they just left it behind. I've tried uploading photos but they wont load.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkside Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street hasnt been cleaned for months, 18th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Woolwich Road, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.title: Cars always parked in bus lane, 18th December
item.description:
Vehicles are frequently parked in the bus lane for longer than the permitted maximum stay. During busy periods, this causes traffic to build up, as the bus lane cannot be used effectively. Allowing parking within a bus lane defeats its purpose, and there should be no parking spaces permitted in this area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 705, Wandsworth Road, Clapham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Athelstan Gardens infront number 12, 18th December
item.description:
Ref: 8553283 You marked the above closed but showed old pictures of LEFF HOUSE not Athelstan Gardens, its not even the same staircase, please actually look at case ref: 8553283 the picture submitted and the picture you have responded with. Different buildings.

item.title: Blocked road drain, 18th December
item.description:
The drain in the road outside 10 Fairfield Road BR51JR is blocked and with the rain from the last few days the water is sitting on the road and causing hazardous driving conditions and is getting continuously worse. This has been an issue previously and has resulted in my house flooding
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairfield Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
